StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Whole Genome Sequencing in Familial and Sporadic Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO DENVERFEDERATION OF AMER SOC FOR EXPER BIOLOGYNATIONAL JEWISH HEALTHVA EASTERN COLORADO HEALTH CARE SYSTEMDUKE UNIVERSITY
UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO DENVERNATIONAL JEWISH HEALTH
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://topmed.nhlbi.nih.gov/acknowledgements. In addition, please include: "We thank the patients with IPF that contributed their DNA to this project and all of the labs and institutions that are members of the Global IPF Consortium."
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
There are five consent groups for this study: (1) HMB-IRB-NPU, (2) DS-LD-IRB-NPU, (3) DS-ILD-IRB-NPU, (4) DS-PFIB-IRB-NPU, and (5) DS-PUL-ILD-IRB-NPU. For all five consent groups, Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted), and use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
(1) For HMB-IRB-NPU: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. (2) For DS-LD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. (3) For DS-ILD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Interstitial Lung Disease. (4) For DS-PFIB-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary Fibrosis. (5) For DS-PUL-ILD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary, Interstitial Lung Disease.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Interstitial Lung Disease, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ILD-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Interstitial Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Pulmonary Fibrosis, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PFIB-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary Fibrosis. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Pulmonary, Interstitial Lung Disease, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PUL-ILD-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary, Interstitial Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: EA-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use by NHLBI WGS study investigators only There are five consent groups for this study: HMB-IRB-NPU, DS-LD-IRB-NPU, DS-ILD-IRB-NPU, DS-PFIB-IRB-NPU, and DS-PUL-ILD-IRB-NPU.
1. For HMB-IRB-NPU: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
2. For DS-LD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
3. For DS-ILD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Interstitial Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
4. For DS-PFIB-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary Fibrosis. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
5. For DS-PUL-ILD-IRB-NPU: Use of the data must be related to Pulmonary, Interstitial Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted). Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
